question:
You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is functional for demonstration purposes.

Data Collection Form: Used to record field survey data, such as facility conditions, questionnaire results, observation records, etc.

Questionnaire Statistics Table: Organizes questionnaire responses, including basic information, satisfaction ratings, and open-ended questions.

Issue Coding Table: Categorizes and codes observed problems for subsequent statistical analysis.

Statistical Analysis Table: Performs descriptive statistics, such as facility coverage rate, problem frequency, etc.

Visualization Chart Templates: Guides users on how to generate bar charts, radar charts, etc. using Excel's built-in charting functions.

Place all the above table contents into a single HTML tool file, with support for Excel import and export functionality on the page.

checklist.title: Is the Data Collection Form fully implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the HTML form properly implements fields for recording field survey data (facility conditions, questionnaire results, observation records). Check for form validation, field types appropriateness (text, number, dropdown, date), and conditional logic. Score 0 if missing entirely, 5 if basic fields exist without validation, and 10 if comprehensively implemented with proper validation and field dependencies.

checklist.title: Is the Questionnaire Statistics Table properly structured?
checklist.description: Review the implementation of the questionnaire responses organization system, including sections for basic information, satisfaction ratings, and open-ended questions. Check for proper data typing, sorting capabilities, filtering options, and aggregation functions. Deduct 3 points if missing search functionality, 3 points if lacking data validation, and 4 points if aggregation functions are absent. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the Issue Coding Table implementation complete?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code includes a robust system for categorizing and coding observed problems with hierarchical categories, subcategories, and unique identifiers. Check for code search functionality, code relationship mapping, and frequency tracking. Deduct 5 points if hierarchical categorization is missing, and 5 points if no code relationship visualization exists. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the Statistical Analysis Table functionality comprehensive?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the implementation includes proper descriptive statistics calculations (mean, median, mode, standard deviation), facility coverage rate calculation, problem frequency analysis, and cross-tabulation capabilities. Check for formula correctness and automatic recalculation. Deduct 3 points for each missing statistical function, and 5 points if calculations contain errors. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid data input, file import/export errors, browser compatibility issues, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Auto-save functionality 2. Dark/light mode toggle 3. Responsive design for mobile devices 4. Data visualization previews). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple data export methods with identical functionality) 2. Function modules unrelated to data collection and analysis (e.g., unnecessary animations) 3. Features that affect performance (e.g., heavy DOM operations or excessive event listeners). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data/view/controller layers), code organization, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if there's no error handling for Excel import/export operations. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional form layout (clear sections, aligned inputs, consistent styling). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic table layouts. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the Excel import/export functionality properly implemented?
checklist.description: Judge whether the Excel import/export functionality works as expected: 1) Supports standard Excel formats (.xlsx, .xls) 2) Maintains data integrity during import/export 3) Provides proper progress indication and error handling 4) Preserves formatting and formulas where appropriate. Deduct 5 points if only one direction (import or export) is implemented, 3 points for data loss during transfer, and 5 points if the operation is not user-friendly. The full score is 10 points.
